intro: Euphrasia schinzii, commonly known as Schinz's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Euphrasia schinzii is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
